title: Do i have to provide financial information to opposing party.
question: I just recently lost temporary conservatorship to opposing party. They have temporary and they are requesting, from me, her bank statements and financial information. This has been filed with the court. The letters have not been issued yet. Even if they have letters tomorrow, do i have to provide that information. They would still need to go to the bank to gain access of her account.
question_tags: Divorce,Bank accounts in divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Child support,Alimony,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and alimony,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Child support modification,Child support and changes in circumstances,Family law,Tax return,Personal information
answers: They probably want to see if you mishandled her financial affairs while serving as temp.

Possibly. Proposed guardian may subpoena relevant non-privileged financial information.
I need more case specific information to further comment.
